items.title: No peace dividend in Trump's Ukraine plan
items.description: An end to fighting in Ukraine will hurt defence shares in the short term, but the boom is likely to continue given US isolationism, says Matthew Lynn

items.title: Saba strikes again at Edinburgh Worldwide
items.description: The activist investor, Saba, seems to be gearing up for a fresh attempt to displace the board of a UK investment trust.

items.title: Will the internet break – and can we protect it?
items.description: The internet is a delicate global physical and digital network that can easily be paralysed. Why is that, and what can be done to bolster its defences...

items.title: Why UK stocks are set to boom
items.description: Despite Labour, there is scope for UK stocks to make more gains in the years ahead, says Max King

items.title: Will NS&I boost Premium Bonds prize fund rate? Why it could rise soon
items.description: NS&I now has a net financing target of £13 billion for the 2025/26 financial year
